div.div: αὐλή , ῆς: court - enclosure, court, court yard, farm-yard; the αὐλή of a mansion had gate-way, portico, stables, slave-quarters, altar, and rotunda (θόλος); see table III. An αὐλή is attributed to the cabin of Eumaeus, the swine-herd, Od. 14.5, to the tent of Achilles, Il. 24.452, and even to the cave of Polyphēmus, Od. 9.239.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
